article.headline: Mercer 68, Savannah St. 64
article.story: MACON, Ga. (AP) -- James Florence led Mercer with 16 points, including a three-point play to tie the game with four and a half minutes to play, as the Bears recovered from a halftime deficit to defeat Savannah State 68-64 Wednesday night. Mercer (10-10), which lost to the Tigers 71-61 in Savannah on Nov. 14, led by seven points, 25-18, with 7:06 to play in the first half. Savannah State (8-15) rallied to take a 38-34 lead into the locker room. The Tigers led by six points, 56-50, with 9:35 left, but Florence hit a layuup five minutes later, was fouled and made the free throw, to tie the game at 58. Mercer edged ahead. Savannah State's Javon Randolph led all scorers with 21 points, including a jumper that got the Tigers back to within one, 65-64, with 33 seconds remaining. But he and Joseph Flegler missed 3-pointers and Flegler missed a jumper in the final seconds while Mercer scored the balance from the foul line.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
